meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a flute in sound or tone.
meanings.sent1: The bird's song was flutelike, echoing through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The wind made a flutelike sound as it passed through the narrow gap.
meanings.sent3: The flutelike music of the ice cream truck always brought smiles to the children's faces.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as flutelike as the melody of a spring breeze.
meanings.sent5: The flutelike notes of the piano filled the room with a sense of calm.

meanings.definition: Having a sound or tone similar to that of a flute.
meanings.sent1: The singer's voice was so flutelike, it mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent2: The flutelike quality of the wind chimes added a soothing touch to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The flutelike whistle of the kettle signaled that the tea was ready.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out in a flutelike melody, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The flutelike call of the distant bird carried across the meadow.
